content:
Children can start learning about money management and basic financial concepts as early as three years old. At this age, they can start to understand the concept of money and its uses, such as buying things they want, and saving money for later.

As children get older, they can learn more advanced financial concepts, such as budgeting, saving, and investing. Parents can start to introduce these concepts to their children around the age of six or seven, depending on their individual development.

It's important for parents to teach their children about finances early on, as it can help them develop good money habits and a healthy relationship with money. This can also set them up for financial success in the future.
